title: When will the cool change hit south-east Australia? | ABC NEWS
description: Extreme heat is affecting parts of the south east, with more severe weather expected this weekend. Dean Narramore from the Bureau of Meteorology reports a cool change will hit southern South Australia and Victoria this weekend.  On Saturday, inland New South Wales and southern Queensland will be warm, but by Sunday, south-eastern Australia will see a significant drop in temperatures. By Monday afternoon, the heat will be gone, and snow may even fall in Tasmanian alpine regions. title: Man, woman and two teenagers dead in suspected murder-suicide in Perth's west | ABC NEWS
description: WA Police are investigating a suspected murder-suicide after four people were found dead in Perth's western suburbs. The 50-year-old male, 49-year-old female, and two boys aged 14 and 16 were discovered in a Mosman Park home. Police say the incident doesn't appear to be violent and that no weapon was used. title: What is Nipah virus? | ABC NEWS
description: Two nurses in India tested positive to Nipah virus earlier this month, prompting travel alerts and screenings at airports across several Asian countries. Epidemiologist Catherine Bennett explains person-to-person transmission is rare and it is rarely responsible for big outbreaks. title: Fri Fix: why Sabalenka is “pissed”, AO softens on cameras and Molineux on winning captaincy
description: Aryna Sabalenka is "pissed", is she right to be? We speak to Roger Rasheed about that as well as the conclusion to the "behind the scenes camera" dramas. Then Sophie Molineux talks to us about winning the Australian captaincy and how she spoke to those who missed out on the role. Featured: Sophie Molineux, Australia cricket captain. Roger Rasheed, elite tennis coach.   Subscribe to the ABC Sport Newsletter (https://www.abc.net.au/connect)

title: Jetstar twice violated own policy on fees for changing support worker's name | ABC NEWS
description: A 22-year-old northern Tasmanian man with a disability was incorrectly told he'd have to pay a fee to change the name of his support worker on a ticket. After an apology and a refund, it happened again. title: Adelaide’s median house price inches closer to $1 million | ABC NEWS
description: Property prices in Adelaide have continued to boom, with the latest Valuer-General data showing a $50,000 increase in the median price of houses sold in the last quarter of 2025. The median house value in Adelaide reached $925,000 in December 2025, and $520,000 for houses in non-metropolitan towns. Experts are forecasting continued growth, but some don't expect the median house price to hit $1 million in 2026. title: Tasmania takes control of ore stockpile after smelter defaults on government loan | ABC NEWS
description: Australia's only manganese alloy smelter, Liberty Bell Bay, was given a $20 million Tasmanian government loan last year that was used to buy a 23,000-tonne shipment of ore.  Despite the delivery arriving, operations at the troubled smelter have not resumed, after being paused indefinitely in May last year. title: NT lawn bowlers bound for Malaysia to learn from the best | ABC NEWS
description: Lawn bowlers from across the Northern Territory are heading to Malaysia to support the Australian Jackaroos as they trial for the Commonwealth Games. The experience will allow the NT team to learn from the best and even get the chance to face off with the Malaysian National team. ABC News Northern Territory reporter Shane Schafer caught up with the team on the green before they head overseas. title: Australia spends more on property investor tax breaks than social housing | ABC NEWS
description: Analysis by the Australian Council of Social Service has found housing stress is worsening, with the government spending more on tax breaks for property investors than on social housing, homelessness initiatives and rent assistance combined.  Senior adviser James Hall says the introduction of the capital gains tax discount and negative gearing has supercharged the housing crisis. He suggests curbing tax breaks to raise revenue for more social housing. title: Construction underway for Parramatta-Olympic Park light rail link | ABC NEWS
description: Construction on Stage 2 of the Parramatta Light Rail, designed to connect Sydney's second central business district with Olympic Park, is underway. However, as the government prepares to start, concerns are emerging about cost overruns and low passenger uptake on the current line. title: Australia closely monitoring Nipah virus after detection in India | ABC NEWS
description: Countries across Asia have reinforced airport health screening to prevent the spread of Nipah after two nurses in India tested positive for the deadly virus. Health Minister Mark Butler says there's no need to tighten Australia's border controls, but authorities are closely monitoring the situation. title: Two teenage boys, parents dead in suspected murder-suicide | ABC NEWS
description: Western Australia Police are investigating a suspected murder-suicide in Mosman Park, Perth, where the bodies of two teenage boys and their parents were found. Authorities confirmed that no weapon was used and there was "no violent incident" related to the deaths. A note was also discovered and is under investigation. description: Donald Trump says he'll soon reveal who he has picked to become the next chair of the Federal Reserve. title: Nine Radio sold for $56m to pub tycoon Arthur Laundy | ABC NEWS
description: Nine Entertainment has sold its radio network, including Sydney's 2GB and Melbourne's 3AW, to pub baron Arthur Laundy for $56 million, down from a valuation of $275 million seven years ago. The company believes that selling its radio assets and acquiring QMS will strengthen its digital presence. description: Premier David Crisafulli has welcomed the federal government's public hospital funding deal but says he'll keep pushing for more.
